IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: A STATEWIDE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT CONNECTS PEOPLE TO FOOD RESOURCES AND FUELS CHANGE IN SYSTEMS, POLICIES AND SOCIAL VIEWS, SO NO COLORADAN GOES HUNGRY. HUNGER FREE COLORADO EXISTS TO END HUNGER IN COLORADO.
IRS990.MissionDesc: HUNGER FREE COLORADO EXISTS TO END HUNGER IN COLORADO.
IRS990.Desc: CLIENT SERVICES: HUNGER FREE COLORADO'S (HFC) CLIENT SERVICES DEPARTMENT MAKES IT EASIER FOR PEOPLE TO ACCESS FOOD WITH DIGNITY USING A BILINGUAL FOOD RESOURCE HOTLINE, BILINGUAL COMMUNITY-BASED OUTREACH AND A STATEWIDE TRAINED AND SUPPORTED NETWORK OF OUTREACH PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS. DURING THE YEAR, OUR FOOD RESOURCE HOTLINE, THE MOBILE OUTREACH TEAM AND OUR OUTREACH PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS CONNECTED MORE THAN 85,000 HOUSEHOLDS TO NUTRITIOUS FOOD RESOURCES, INCLUDING THE SUPPLEMENTAL NUTRITION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (SNAP), THE SPECIAL SUPPLEMENTAL NUTRITION PROGRAM FOR WOMEN, INFANTS AND CHILDREN (WIC), THE FREE AND REDUCED PRICED LUNCH PROGRAM, FOOD PANTRIES, AND MEAL SITES. HFC AND OUR PARTNERS TOGETHER SUBMITTED ONLINE SNAP APPLICATIONS ON BEHALF OF MORE THAN 24,000 HOUSEHOLDS WHILE ALSO HELPING THEM LOCATE NEARBY AND CONVENIENT FOOD RESOURCES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE FARM TO FOOD PANTRY INITIATIVE: HFC ORGANIZED AND COORDINATES A GROUP OF MORE THAN 80 FOOD PANTRIES KNOWN AS THE COLORADO FOOD PANTRY NETWORK(CFPN). CFPN WAS FORMED TO ENABLE FOOD PANTRIES TO WORK TOGETHER IN MEETING THE NEEDS OF THEIR COMMUNITIES BY SHARING RESOURCES AND BEST PRACTICES. DURING THE LAST YEAR, HFC CONTINUED TO WORK WITH CFPN MEMBERS AND ABOUT 20 ADDITIONAL FOOD PANTRIES TO INCREASE THE AMOUNT OF NUTRITIOUS FOOD THEY COULD DISTRIBUTE BY SOURCING FOOD FROM COLORADO FARMERS AND RANCHERS. THIS FARM TO FOOD PANTRY INITIATIVE IS IMPROVING THE NUTRITIONAL VALUE OF FOOD PANTRY ITEMS AND IS REACHING AN ESTIMATED 100,000 FOOD PANTRY CLIENTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: POLICY AND ADVOCACY: HFC'S POLICY AND ADVOCACY EFFORTS HELP ADVANCE POLICIES THAT INCREASE ACCESS TO NUTRITIOUS FOOD ACROSS THE STATE. WITH OUR NATIONAL PARTNERS, HFC SUCCESSFULLY ADVOCATED TO SECURE FROM CONGRESS A SHORT-TERM FINANCIAL BOOST FOR THE NATIONAL SCHOOL LUNCH PROGRAM FOR THE COMING YEAR. HFC SUCCESSFULLY ADVOCATED FOR 3 MILLION IN STATE FUNDING FOR THE FOOD PANTRY ASSISTANCE GRANT THAT IS DISTRIBUTED TO FOOD PANTRIES TO ASSIST THEM IN PURCHASING HEALTHY FOOD ITEMS FROM COLORADO FARMERS AND RANCHERS. HFC ALSO SECURED BIPARTISAN STATE LEGISLATIVE SUPPORT FOR A PROPOSED STATE HEALTHY SCHOOL MEALS FOR ALL BILL THAT WAS REFERRED TO THE NOVEMBER 2022 BALLOT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OUR PRIMARY LEGISLATIVE PRIORITY WAS CONTINUING TO BUILD LONG-TERM AND IMPACTFUL RELATIONSHIPS WITH STATE AND FEDERAL LEGISLATORS. BY CONTINUING TO DEVELOP OUR PRESENCE WITH OUR ELECTED OFFICIALS, WE WERE LAYING A FOUNDATION TO CREATE SUCCESSFUL ANTI-HUNGER LEGISLATION, AND TO HEAD OFF ANY HARMFUL BILLS THAT WOULD NEGATIVELY IMPACT OUR LOW-INCOME FRIENDS AND NEIGHBORS. LOBBYING CENTERED ON ADMINISTRATIVE POLICY THAT IMPROVES NUTRITION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM IMPLEMENTATION, AND LEGISLATIVE POLICY THAT CREATES NEW LEGISLATION AND RULES TO SUPPORT ANTI-HUNGER INITIATIVES THROUGHOUT THE STATE AND NATION.

THE ORGANIZATION FOLLOWS THE ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES ACCOUNTING STANDARD WHICH REQUIRES THE ORGANIZATION TO DETERMINE WHETHER A TAX POSITION (AND THE RELATED TAX BENEFIT) IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT TO BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY THE APPLICABLE TAXING AUTHORITY, BASED SOLELY ON THE TECHNICAL MERITS OF THE POSITION. THE TAX BENEFIT TO BE RECOGNIZED IS MEASURED AS THE LARGEST AMOUNT OF BENEFIT THAT IS GREATER THAN FIFTY PERCENT LIKELY OF BEING REALIZED UPON SETTLEMENT, PRESUMING THAT THE TAX POSITION IS EXAMINED BY THE APPROPRIATE TAXING AUTHORITY THAT HAS FULL KNOWLEDGE OF ALL RELEVANT INFORMATION. DURING THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2022, THE ORGANIZATION'S MANAGEMENT EVALUATED ITS TAX POSITIONS TO DETERMINE THE EXISTENCE OF UNCERTAINTIES, AND DID NOT NOTE ANY MATTERS THAT WOULD REQUIRE RECOGNITION OR WHICH MAY HAVE AN AFFECT ON ITS TAX-EXEMPT STATUS.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: CARE & SHARE FOOD BANK OF SOUTHERN

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MONITORING OF GRANTS IS DONE BY 1)OVERSIGHT BY DESIGNATED STAFF WHO PROVIDE TRAINING AND GUIDANCE ON THE PROPER USE OF FUNDS TO ORGANIZATIONS RECEIVING THE GRANT AND; 2) MONTHLY PROGRAM AND FINANCIAL REPORTS TO HUNGER FREE COLORADO FROM THE ORGANIZATION RECEIVING THE GRANT.

CLIENT SERVICES: HUNGER FREE COLORADO'S (HFC) CLIENT SERVICES DEPARTMENT MAKES IT EASIER FOR PEOPLE TO ACCESS FOOD WITH DIGNITY USING A BILINGUAL FOOD RESOURCE HOTLINE, BILINGUAL COMMUNITY-BASED OUTREACH AND A STATEWIDE TRAINED AND SUPPORTED NETWORK OF OUTREACH PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS. DURING THE YEAR, OUR FOOD RESOURCE HOTLINE, THE MOBILE OUTREACH TEAM AND OUR OUTREACH PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS CONNECTED MORE THAN 85,000 HOUSEHOLDS TO NUTRITIOUS FOOD RESOURCES, INCLUDING THE SUPPLEMENTAL NUTRITION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (SNAP), THE SPECIAL SUPPLEMENTAL NUTRITION PROGRAM FOR WOMEN, INFANTS AND CHILDREN (WIC), THE FREE AND REDUCED PRICED LUNCH PROGRAM, FOOD PANTRIES, AND MEAL SITES. HFC AND OUR PARTNERS TOGETHER SUBMITTED ONLINE SNAP APPLICATIONS ON BEHALF OF MORE THAN 24,000 HOUSEHOLDS WHILE ALSO HELPING THEM LOCATE NEARBY AND CONVENIENT FOOD RESOURCES.
THE PROCESS IS TO FIRST SEND THE 990 TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS. ONCE THEY HAVE REVIEWED IT, THE ORGANIZATION WILL E-FILE IT.
MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT ANNUALLY.
THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEWS THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S COMPENSATION ANNUALLY AND APPROVES COMPENSATION.
